I’m a data analyst, a journalist and a writer.

I define myself as a digital humanist and a digital enthusiast. I have studied literature and languages before delving into programming. And, well, I have learned a lot. I am pretty good at what I do.

If you like discussing art, books, cinema, video-games, politics and cats, you are in safe hands.

Hi, I’m Francesca

Get to know me

Projects

CV

Summary: My final project for the Digital Humanities and Digital Knowledge Master’s Degree course. It explores the nuances of digital sexism and online hate speech within film review communities, specifically focusing on IMDb and Letterboxd.

Key-words: Information Visualization, Data Analysis, Cinema, Digital Feminism

Dissecting Hate

Check it out!

My (latest) projects

Through the Gaze

Summary: An overview on the presence of the male gaze in mainstream Western cinematic industry, heavily influenced by the United States' cinema. It examines the ten highest-grossing U.S. films for each decade from the 1940s to the 2010s and analyses their scripts, audiences and data.

Key-words: Information Visualization, Audience Analysis, Storytelling, Male Gaze

Bars Behind Bars

Summary:  The project aims at analyzing the impact of different factors in the context of suicide in prisons across Europe. It can be described as a digitally ethical analysis of a delicate and complex phenomenon, that unites the legal field with the application of computational methods.

Key-words: Digital Ethics, Open Data, Report, Europe, Social Sciences
